Summary: close to dtw airport watched thru binoculars southern sky, below moon eminated radiant colors of blue, red and green in a somewhat flame formation noticed for 45 mins then got smaller and then unnoticable
divs: Sighting DetailsI noticed a bright light in the southern sky well below the moon with my naked eye, It was near detroit metro airport, i could see a few airplanes passing and this looked nothing like that, so not having a telescope or camera besides my i phone i grabbed my binoculars and could see bright radiant colors eminating in a flame like formation with mostly bright colors of red, green and blue appendage like shapes,from what i originally thought could be a star but seemed awful close and low and besides it was a cloudy night sky, i could only see the moon although not fully dark out yet, it was there for 45 min's that i noticed and it became much darker towards the end, i would guess it to not be real far being my binoculars are standard type not super powerful so i am curious if anyone else reports this
